articles.title: 7th DPRK-US Senior Colonel-level Military Working Contact Made
articles.content:
7th DPRK-US Senior Colonel-level Military Working Contact Made
Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- The 7th round of the DPRK-U.S. senior colonel-level military working contact was made in Panmunjom on Wednesday.
					 The DPRK side, to begin with, strongly urged the U.S. forces side to accept the DPRK proposal on bringing "evidence" for the sunken "Cheonan" case to Panmunjom and jointly verifying it, the new proposal advanced by the DPRK side at the previous contact.
					
					 While admitting the validity of the proposal, the U.S. forces side, however, repeatedly revealed its intention to make the "results of joint investigation" an established fact. And it employed every possible gimmick to shun the DPRK proposal for joint verification.
					
					 In this connection the DPRK side repeatedly questioned the U.S. forces side whether it intends to overturn even the agreed agenda item on probing the truth about the "Cheonan" case, why it is afraid of conducting a joint investigation into the controversial evidence while trumpeting about "results" of the scientific and objective "joint investigation" and why it refuses to accept the said proposal.
					
					 Much upset by this, the U.S. forces side failed to give any answer to those questions, only uttering that these questions are not in line with the nature of the contact. And it made a clumsy excuse, asserting that it is not in a position to give any answer to this proposal.
					
					 Noting that the attitude shown by the U.S. forces side at the seven rounds of the contact made till now proves that the "Cheonan" case has nothing to do with the DPRK, its side continued:
					
					 Now is the time for the U.S. forces side to respond to the joint verification or advance any alternative offer for settling the issue and if it has no intention to do so, it should make assurances that it will not blame the DPRK any longer.
					
					 There is a limit to the patience of the army and people of the DPRK. 
					
					 If the U.S. forces side refuses to meet this last demand of the DPRK, the DPRK side will have no option but to bring to light the true nature of the charade orchestrated by the U.S. and the south Korean group of traitors.

articles.title: North-South Red Cross Talks Held
articles.content:
North-South Red Cross Talks Held
Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- North-south Red Cross talks were held in Kaesong on Oct. 26 and 27.
					Present there were the DPRK side delegation led by Choe Song Ik, vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Red Cross Society of the DPRK, and the south side delegation with Kim Ryong Hyon, secretary general of the Red Cross of south Korea as its chief delegate. 
					
					The head of the DPRK side delegation spoke first at the talks.
					
					Underlining the need for the Red Cross organizations of the north and the south to fully solve the pending humanitarian issues in line with the desire and wishes of the fellow countrymen and contribute to improving the north-south relations, he continued:
					
					What is most important is for the north and the south to remain true to the noble idea and mission of Red Cross humanitarianism.
					
					In the past the north and the south made not a few efforts to relieve the other side of pain, misfortune and aftermaths of natural disasters while helping and cooperating with each other when in need on the principle of noble compatriotism and mutual support and assistance. 
					
					The humanitarian work between the north and the south can be truly meaningful and bear good fruits only when it is sincerely done without seeking any interests on the principle of mutual support and assistance, the nation's traditional good manners and customs.
					
					Last year the DPRK realized the reunion of separated families and relatives without any conditions on the occasion of the Harvest Moon Day and sent back the fishing boat and its crew of the south side which illegally intruded into the territorial waters of the DPRK side and the personnel of the south side who were put in custody after conducting illegal actions in the Kaesong Industrial Zone under the complicated situation where the north-south relations were severed.
					
					This year it proposed arranging the reunion of separated families and relatives again on the occasion of the Harvest Moon Day and sent back soon a
					
					fishing boat of the south side and its crew that intruded into the economic waters of the DPRK side under the situation where the north-south confrontation grew tenser.
					
					Pointing out that Red Cross humanitarian issues can surely be settled if the north and the south make joint efforts from a sincere attitude and stand, the head of the delegation of the DPRK side proposed the following points to be discussed and solved at the talks.
					
					First, he proposed organizing the reunion of separated families and relatives on a normal footing.
					
					The proposal includes the arrangement of 3-4 reunions of separated families and relatives each year with main emphasis on organizing them on the occasions of folk holidays and the proper combination of them with video meeting and video exchange of letters. 100 from each side can be involved in the reunion to suit the actual conditions and the number of reunions and that of those involved in them may be increased depending on the improvement of the inter-Korean relations and creation of an atmosphere of reconciliation in the future.
					
					 Then it is necessary to reenergize the humanitarian cooperation.
					
					To this end it is necessary to create environment and conditions for revitalizing the humanitarian cooperation undertaking.
					
					The proposals advanced by the DPRK side at the talks are the most realistic and reasonable offers as they reflected its firm will to settle the issue of the reunion of separated families and relatives in the north and the south and other humanitarian matters in line with the desire and wishes of all fellow countrymen.
					
					The south side, however, insisted on the discussion on the issue of making the reunion of separated families and relatives regular, persistently shunning the sincere proposals of the DPRK side and took the stand of rejecting under absurd pretexts the matters of creating urgent conditions for putting the reunion on a normal footing including the issue of regularly operating the Mt. Kumgang Reunion Centre.
					
					In the end, the south side went the lengths of suggesting to discuss the matter at the next round of the talks, openly shunning the discussion on the matter itself. It insisted on opening the next round of the talks late in November, delaying the date of opening the talks.
					
					This proves that the south side came out for the talks under the pressure of public opinion at home and abroad.
					
					The stand of the south side, in the final analysis, clearly proved that it, in fact, has no intention to settle the issue of the reunion of separated families and relatives, revitalize the humanitarian work and settle the overall inter-Korean relations, while paying lip-service to the solution of the humanitarian issues.
					
					The DPRK side warned the south side that if it, persisting in its insincere approach, lays a hurdle in the humanitarian work and shuns the process to improve the inter-Korean relations, the DPRK will be compelled to reconsider the sincere proposals and measures made so far to find solution to humanitarian issues and whether or not the reunion of separated families and relatives is let to go on will entirely depend on the attitude of the south side.
					
					At the talks both sides agreed to further the discussion on the pending issues of mutual concern as regards the Red Cross humanitarian work between the north and the south. It was agreed to have the next round of talks on Nov. 25 and fix their venue later.

articles.title: Kim Yong Il Meets Delegation of CPC
articles.content:
Kim Yong Il Meets Delegation of CPC
Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Il, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, met and had a talk with the delegation of the Dandong City, Liaoning Province, Committee of the Communist Party of China led by its Secretary Dai Yulin who paid a courtesy call on him on Wednesday.
					 Saying that it was honor for him to visit the DPRK at a very important time, the head of the delegation reiterated his will to contribute to steadily developing the Sino-DPRK friendly relations provided by the leaders of the elder generation of the two countries.

articles.title: Gift from Delegation of CPC
articles.content:
Gift from Delegation of CPC
Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the visiting delegation of the Dandong City, Liaoning Province, Committee of the Communist Party of China.
					 It was handed to Kim Yong Il, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, on Wednesday by Dai Yulin, secretary of the city committee who is heading the delegation.

articles.title: Chinese Embassy Officials Help Korean Farmers
articles.content:
Chinese Embassy Officials Help Korean Farmers 
Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Liu Hongcai and his embassy officials did a friendship work on the DPRK-China Friendship Thaekam Cooperative Farm in Sunan District, Pyongyang, on Wednesday.
					 The guests helped farmers in rice threshing. 
					
					 The ambassador noted that the Sino-DPRK friendship has grown stronger as the days go by under the deep care of the top leaders of the two countries, wishing the farmers bigger successes in their agricultural production. 
					
					 They handed aid materials to the farm.

articles.title: School Named after Chinese Martyr
articles.content:
School Named after Chinese Martyr
Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- There is a secondary school named after a Chinese martyr, Huang Jieguang, in Kosong County, Kangwon Province.
					 Huang was a member of the Chinese People's Volunteers (CPV) who died a heroic death in the Korean war (June 1950-July 1953) against the U.S. imperialist aggression forces.
					
					 The Party and Government of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea awarded the internationalist fighter the title of DPRK Hero and had Ryomsong Senior Middle School named after Huang Jieguang on the occasion of the 40th anniversary of the CPV's entry into the Korean war to add luster to his feats. Now it is called Huang Jieguang Secondary School.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il sent educational and cultural equipment to the school in several installments for its development.
					
					  Kim Il Sung, when meeting teachers and students of the school on an excursion tour near Kuryong Falls in Mt. Kumgang, gave them detailed instructions as regards education and had a photo taken with them.
					
					 The school, known as an exemplary one in the country, boasts of physical, chemical and all other necessary laboratories and service facilities.
					
					 China has donated numbers of teaching aids and books to the school, which has been visited by many Chinese guests.
					
					 It has also been visited by lots of local people to mark the 60th anniversary of the CPV's entry into the Korean war.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Turkmenistan
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Turkmenistan
 Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a message of greetings to Gurbanguly Berdymuhamedov, president of Turkmenistan, on the occasion of its national day.
					 Kim in the message expressed belief that the relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would develop, wishing the people of Turkmenistan well-being and prosperity.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Danish Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Danish Ambassador 
Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from Peter Lysholt Hansen, Danish ambassador to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Wednesday.
					 After receiving the credentials, Kim had a talk with the ambassador.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Greets Prime Minister of Saint Vincent and Grenadines
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Greets Prime Minister of Saint Vincent and Grenadines
Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim Wednesday sent a message of greetings to Ralf Gonsalves, prime minister of Saint Vincent and the Grenadines, on the occasion of the 31st anniversary of its independence.
					 The message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would develop on good terms in the future, too, wishing the people of Saint Vincent and the Grenadines progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok Meets Delegation of British Lawmakers
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Meets Delegation of British Lawmakers
Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, met and had a talk with the delegation of the British-DPRK All-Party Parliamentary Group led by David Alton, member of the House of Lords and chairman of the group, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Wednesday.

articles.title: Implementing Agreement on Cultural Cooperation Signed between DPRK and Syria
articles.content:
Implementing Agreement on Cultural Cooperation Signed between DPRK and Syria
Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- The 2010-2012 inter-governmental plan for implementing the agreement on cultural cooperation between the DPRK and Syria was signed here Wednesday.
					 It was inked by Jon Yong Jin, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, and Souheil Haidar, Syrian charge d'affaires ad interim here.

articles.title: DPRK Cabinet Gives Reception for Men Footballers
articles.content:
DPRK Cabinet Gives Reception for Men Footballers
Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Cabinet gave a reception at Okryu Restaurant on Wednesday in honor of the DPRK men footballers who won the 2010 Asian U-19 Soccer Championship.
					 Present there were Ri Thae Nam, vice-premier of the Cabinet, Pak Myong Chol, minister of Physical Culture and Sports, Ri Jong Mu, general officer of the Korean People's Army, and officials, sportsmen and coaches in the sports field.
					
					 Ri Thae Nam said in his speech at the reception that on behalf of the Cabinet he warmly congratulated the footballers on emerging a winner in the above-said championship.
					
					 The success made by the football players brought great joy to the servicepersons and people who are bringing about great innovations and leap forward in the drive for building a thriving nation, he noted, calling upon all the footballers and coaches to round off the Korean-style tactics and technique, intensify their trainings and thus register signal successes in international matches. 
					
					 Ri Hyok Chol in his speech made on behalf of the footballers extended the warmest thanks and best wishes to General Secretary Kim Jong Il for having shown profound loving care for the sportspersons of the DPRK.
					
					 He renewed his will to shed more sweat in trainings with the single desire to continue glorifying the honor of Songun Korea with gold medals and thus live up to the expectations of the country and its people.

articles.title: DPRK Football Team Beats Its Iranian Rival 2-0
articles.content:
DPRK Football Team Beats Its Iranian Rival 2-0
Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- The DPRK boys football team beat its Iranian rival 2-0 at the 2010 Asian U-16 Soccer Championship now under way in Uzbekistan from Oct. 24.
					 The championship brought together teams of 16 countries.
					
					 The DPRK team belonging to Group B drew 1-1 in the first league match with its Syrian rival held on Oct. 24.
					
					 It trounced its Iranian rival 2-0 in its second match on Oct. 26, leading other teams in the group together with the Syrian team.
					
					 It will play its last league match with its Oman rival on Oct. 28.

articles.title: New Hatching Machine Developed
articles.content:
New Hatching Machine Developed
Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Chaek University of Technology has developed a new model of hatching machine.
					 The machine is capable of comprehensively measuring, monitoring and recording the growth of poultry eggs and automatically controlling temperature and humidity of incubator, egg rolling, ventilation and so on.
					
					 It is available for all domestic fowls, including hen, goose and ostrich. It has already been introduced in some chicken and duck farms to prove high in hatchability.

articles.title: Round-table Talks Held in Beijing of Entry of CPV into Korean Front
articles.content:
Round-table Talks Held in Beijing of Entry of CPV into Korean Front
Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- Round-table talks took place at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing on Monday on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the entry of the Chinese People's Volunteers into the Korean front.
					 Present there were Hu Jintao, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, president of the People's Republic of China and chairman of the Central Military Commission, and other party and state senior officials of China.
					
					 The round-table talks were presided over by Xu Caihou, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the CPC and vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission.
					
					 Xi Jinping, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the CPC, vice-president of China and vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the CPC, made a speech on behalf of the C.C., the CPC, the State Council and the Central Military Commission. 
					
					 Referring to the fact that the 60th anniversary of the entry of the CPV into the Korean front is now being grandly commemorated, he said:
					
					 The heroic servicepersons of the CPV waged life-or-death bloody battles in the same trench with the army and people of the DPRK under the uplifted banner of justice for defending peace from aggression, thus achieving a great victory in the war resisting the U.S. and aiding Korea.
					
					 This was a great victory won in defending the world peace and achieving human progress.
					
					 The heroic feats performed by the fallen fighters who kept azaleas in full bloom on the soil of Korea at the cost of their blood will always go down in history. It is six decades since then but the Chinese people still remember the great militant friendship sealed in blood by the armies and peoples of the two countries and touching stories about the DPRK government and people's care, love and sincere help to the CPV.
					
					 The war resisting the U.S. and aiding Korea was the first large-scale international limited war after the end of World War II and there was striking disparity in military equipment between the two warring parties but the CPV, shoulder to shoulder with the Korean People's Army, achieved steady shining victories.
					
					 Through arduous yet preeminent battles, the CPV and the KPA dealt a heavy blow at the imperialist aggressors, compelling the enemies to sign the Armistice Agreement on July 27, 1953.
					
					 The great war resisting the U.S. and aiding Korea was a war of justice for defending peace from aggression.
					
					 The source of strength of the CPV and the factor of its victory lay in the justice of the above-said war.
					
					 All the great victories achieved by the CPV on the Korean front would be unthinkable without the positive support of the people of different nationalities throughout China.
					
					 It was thanks to their positive support and encouragement that the servicepersons of the CPV could overcome all the difficulties during the war with resentment against the enemies and beat back the formidable enemies, finally winning a victory in the war.
					
					 More than 50 years have passed since the ceasefire in the above-said war, but the wounds and pain inflicted by this hard-fought war to people will never be healed and their memory of it will never fade away no matter how much water may flow under the bridge.
					
					 The Korean Peninsula is linked with China by the same mountain and rivers and defending peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula and the rest of Northeast Asia is linked with the overall situation of the struggle for the peace and stability of the world.
					
					 Consistent are the basic stand and political approach of China towards this issue.

articles.title: Japan's Nuclear Weaponization Blasted
articles.content:
Japan's Nuclear Weaponization Blasted 
Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- Some time ago, NHK of Japan reported that the Japanese government examined in secrecy the issue of having access to nukes in the 1960s. This goes to prove that Japan had already pushed forward nuclear weaponization since the 1960s. 
					 Minju Joson Wednesday observes this in a signed commentary.
					
					 As known worldwide, Japan declared in 1968 the "three non-nuclear principles that ban the country from possessing, producing or allowing nuclear weapons on its territory" and has since pretended to pursue the policy of not possessing nukes.
					
					 However, Japan examined in secrecy the issue of having access to nukes as soon as it declared the "three non-nuclear principles." This fact indicates that those three principles touted by it are nothing but a fig-leaf to cover up its moves to go nuclear. 
					
					 The recently disclosed facts about Japan's moves for nuclear weaponization bring to light the true colors of the Japanese reactionaries who play a double game, prompted by their nuclear ambition for overseas expansion. This once again testifies to the hypocrisy of their loud-mouthed "three non-nuclear principles".
					
					 Japan is now seeking a war, not peace, and leaving no means untried to achieve its goal for reinvasion. 
					
					 Not only Asia but the rest of the world may suffer a nuclear disaster due to the nuclear ambition of Japan. 
					
					 That is why the international community remains highly vigilant against Japan's moves to go nuclear. 
					
					 The moves stepped by Japan for nuclear weaponization under the veil of the "three non-nuclear principles" are little short of digging its own pitfall.

articles.title: Japanese Imperialists' Forcible Drafting of Koreans under Fire
articles.content:
Japanese Imperialists' Forcible Drafting of Koreans under Fire
Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- The Committee for Investigating Damage Done by Japan through Forcible Mobilization during Resistance against It and Supporting Victims of Forcible Mobilization Abroad, Etc. in south Korea exposed the Japanese imperialists' forcible drafting of Koreans in the past on October 19.
					 The organization conducted an investigation in a little over 5 years from 2005 and, on this basis, opened to the public a report on the investigation into the ages and birth places of 213 Koreans who met deaths while being subject to forced labor at coal mines in Japan, the cause of their deaths, etc. 
					
					 According to the report, at that time Japan pursued it as a policy to bring families of Korean draftees for the purpose of increasing productivity, etc. 
					
					 It is written in the report that a large number of Korean couples or families existed in the area of the Sakito Coal Mine because the institution concerned and company sought the increase of productivity and effectiveness of labor management at that time.
					
					 32 percent of 213 Korean dead was children under five years old, 39 percent of them was young people from the age of 16 to 30, the report added.
					
					 It is also disclosed by the report that the Mitsubishi munitions company, which operated the said coal mine, sent its agents in charge of drafting Koreans to the areas of Korea under its plan to take Koreans to Japan by force. 
					
					 It was additionally disclosed by the report that 89 percent of the Koreans forcibly drafted to work in the coal mine was Korean men in the twenties-thirties hailing from Ryongnam and Honam areas and they were drafted centering around Jolla and Kyongsang provinces close to Japan.
					
					 The above-said facts clearly show another glimpse of the atrocities committed by the Japanese imperialists through the forcible drafting.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Authorities' Crackdown Assailed
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Authorities' Crackdown Assailed 
Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- The Students Committee of the Youth and Students Solidarity for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration (June 15 Students Committee) in south Korea issued a statement on Oct. 22 assailing the puppet authorities for their reckless crackdown.
					 The statement recalled that a warrant of arrest requested by the prosecution for Mun Kyong Hwan, chairman of the Executive Committee of the Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration, on Oct. 21 was confirmed at the Seoul Northern District Court on the same day.
					
					 The statement accused the security authorities of taking such action on the charge of violating the "National Security Law" after failing to seek any clue during their search of his house in last June.
					
					 The authorities are intensifying as never before the crackdown upon the solidarity and those affiliated to it as evidenced by their groundless search of their houses without any convincing evidence, it noted, adding this is aimed at creating a terror-ridden atmosphere among the people and dampening the mounting anti-"government" spirit. 
					
					 The June 15 Students Committee will no longer remain an onlooker to the authorities' crackdown prompted by a sinister intention, warns the statement.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il deposita ofrendas florales ante tumbas de martires chinos
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il deposita ofrendas florales ante tumbas de martires chinos
Pyongyang, 27 de octubre (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, junto con los secretarios del Comite Central del PTC y los miembros de la Comision Militar Central del PTC, coloco el dia 26 ofrendas florales ante la tumba de Mao Anying, hijo del gran lider del pueblo chino Mao Zedong, y las tumbas de martires del Cuerpo de Voluntarios del Pueblo Chino en el distrito de Hoechang de la provincia de Phyong-an del Sur, con motivo del 60o aniversario de la participacion de este Cuerpo en el frente coreano. 
					　Entre los acompanantes figuraban Ri Yong Ho, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico (BP) del Comite Central del PTC, vicepresidente de la Comision Militar Central del PTC y jefe del Estado Mayor General del EPC, Kim Jong Un, vicepresidente de la Comision Militar Central del PTC, Kim Yong Chun, miembro del BP del CC del PTC, vicepresidente del CDN y ministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok y Hong Sok Hyong, miembros del BP y secretarios del CC del PTC, Kim Kyong Hui, miembro del BP y jefa de departamento del CC del PTC, Jang Song Thaek, miembro suplente del BP del CC del PTC y vicepresidente del CDN, Kim Jong Gak, miembro suplente del BP del CC del PTC y primer subjefe de la Direccion Politica General del EPC, Kim Yong Il, Kim Yang Gon, Pak To Chun, Choe Ryong Hae, Thae Jong Su y Kim Phyong Hae, miembros suplentes del BP y secretarios del CC del PTC, Mun Kyong Dok, miembro suplente del BP y secretario del CC del PTC y secretario responsable
					
					  del Comite del PTC en la Ciudad de Pyongyang, Ju Kyu Chang, miembro suplente del BP y jefe de departamento del CC del PTC, U Tong Chuk, miembro suplente del BP del CC del PTC y miembro de la Comision Militar Central del PTC, Kim Myong Guk, Kim Kyong Ok, Kim Won Hong, Jong Myong Do, Ri Pyong Chol, Kim Yong Chol y Yun Jong Rin, miembros de la Comision Militar Central del PTC. 
					
					　Estaban enfiladas alli las Guardias de Honor de las fuerzas terrestres, navales y aereas del EPC y de las Fuerzas Rojas Obrero-Campesinas.
					
					　Despues de interpretados los himnos nacionales de China y Corea, mientras resonaba la musica de la ocasion, el Dirigente deposito junto con sus acompanantes las ofrendas florales ante la tumba de Mao Anying y las de martires chinos y guardo un momento de silencio en memoria de ellos. 
					
					　Luego, el Dirigente recorrio las tumbas. 
					
					　Recordando con gran emocion los meritos de los combatientes del Cuerpo de Voluntarios del Pueblo Chino realizados en la pasada Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria (1950-1953), el dijo que el noble espiritu de sacrificio y la fraternidad combativa manifestados por los martires chinos quedaran eternamente en el corazon del pueblo coreano. 
					
					　En las montanas y campos de nuestro pais estan impregnados la sangre derramada por los combatientes del Cuerpo de Voluntarios del Pueblo Chino y sus nobles meritos y espiritu, afirmo y apunto la necesidad de cuidar bien las tumbas de los martires chinos que dedicaron la vida por la causa comun, para que se transmitieran eternamente sus brillantes hazanas.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il visita ex Comandancia de CVPCh en Hoechang
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il visita ex Comandancia de CVPCh en Hoechang
 Pyongyang, 27 de octubre (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, junto con los secretarios del CC del PTC y los miembros de la Comision Militar Central del PTC, visito el dia 26 la ex Comandancia del Cuerpo de Voluntarios del Pueblo Chino en el distrito de Hoechang, con motivo del 60o aniversario de la participacion de este cuerpo en el frente coreano.
					  En la ocasion el fue acompanado por Ri Yong Ho, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico (BP) del Comite Central del PTC, vicepresidente de la Comision Militar Central del PTC y jefe del Estado Mayor General del EPC, Kim Jong Un, vicepresidente de la Comision Militar Central del PTC, Kim Yong Chun, miembro del BP del CC del PTC, vicepresidente del CDN y ministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok y Hong Sok Hyong, miembros del BP y secretarios del CC del PTC, Kim Kyong Hui, miembro del BP y jefa de departamento del CC del PTC, Jang Song Thaek, miembro suplente del BP del CC del PTC y vicepresidente del CDN, Kim Jong Gak, miembro suplente del BP del CC del PTC y primer subjefe de la Direccion Politica General del EPC, Kim Yong Il, Kim Yang Gon, Pak To Chun, Choe Ryong Hae, Thae Jong Su y Kim Phyong Hae, miembros suplentes del BP y secretarios del CC del PTC, Mun Kyong Dok, miembro suplente del BP y secretario del CC del PTC y secretario responsable de
					
					 l Comite del PTC en la Ciudad de Pyongyang, Ju Kyu Chang, miembro suplente del BP y jefe de departamento del CC del PTC, U Tong Chuk, miembro suplente del BP del CC del PTC y miembro de la Comision Militar Central del PTC, Kim Myong Guk, Kim Kyong Ok, Kim Won Hong, Jong Myong Do, Ri Pyong Chol, Kim Yong Chol y Yun Jong Rin, miembros de la Comision Militar Central del PTC.
					
					  Estan conservados en forma original la sala de mando de operaciones, el tunel subterraneo, la casa de militares y otros edificios usados por los oficiales y soldados del Cuerpo de Voluntarios del Pueblo Chino situados en el valle de Hamji de la cabecera de Hoechang donde se hallaba la Comandancia del citado Cuerpo en el periodo de la pasada Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria.
					
					  El Presidente Kim Il Sung visito en varias ocasiones incluido el 19 de octubre del 1951 este lugar, donde presento la orientacion estrategica para lograr la victoria en la guerra y abrio la nueva fase de la guerra en estrecha cooperacion con la Comandancia del Cuerpo de Voluntarios.
					
					  Al recorrer varios lugares de la comandancia donde estan impregnadas vividamente las huellas de la guerra, el Dirigente recordo con profunda emocion los inolvidables dias de la historia cuando los coreanos libraban la sagrada lucha antiyanqui compartiendo la vida y la muerte, las alegrias y las penas con los oficiales y soldados chinos.
					
					  El 25 de octubre de 1950 cuando el pueblo coreano desarrollaba las duras batallas contra las fuerzas aliadas imperialistas acaudilladas por los yanquis, el partido y el gobierno de China encabezados por el gran lider del pueblo chino Mao Zedong enviaron al frente coreano el CVPCh organizado por los mejores hijos del pueblo chino bajo la bandera de "resistir a los yanquis, ayudar a Corea, y defender el hogar y el pais propios" y ayudaron con la sangre la justa lucha del pueblo coreano, senalo y subrayo que el partido y el pueblo chinos dieron la sincera ayuda material y espiritual al pueblo coreano aun en las condiciones tan dificiles, inmediatamente despues de haberse fundado la Republica Popular China, lo cual es un ejemplo vivido del internacionalismo proletario.
					
					  El heroe Huang Jieguang quien garantizo la victoria combativa de la unidad cubriendo con su cuerpo la aspillera enemiga en el pico Sanggam, Mao Anying, hijo del camarada Mao Zedong, y otros numerosos conocidos y desconocidos combatientes del cuerpo de voluntarios chinos ofrendaron sin titubeo su preciosa juventud y vida en el frente coreano, destaco y anadio que aunque transcurrieron  los 60 anos, el ejercito y el pueblo de Corea no olvidan para siempre las proezas heroicas de ellos quines lucharon con valentia derramando sangre en las montanas y campos de Corea.
					
					  Apunto que heredar bien y desarrollar la invencible amistad Corea-China establecida con la sangre en la lucha por la independencia antiimperialista y el socialismo y heredada como la valiosa riqueza por los dirigentes de la veterana generacion de los dos paises es la historica responsabilidad comun y la mision importante de ambos paises.
					
					  Destaco que segun la invariable voluntad y anhelo de los partidos, gobiernos y pueblos de Corea y China, la tradicional amistad Corea-China sera eterna y brillara de generacion en generacion.
					
					  Apunto que consolidar la amistad Corea-China que ha superado todos los vientos y las pruebas de la historia es la firme e invariable orientacion del partido y el gobierno de la RPDC y expreso la esperanza y la conviccion de que todo el ejercito y el pueblo de Corea apreciaran tal amistad tradicional y fortaleceran activamente junto con el pueblo chino en el nivel mas alto las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion Corea-China.

articles.title: Conversaciones entre delegaciones de Corea y China
articles.content:
Conversaciones entre delegaciones de Corea y China 
Pyongyang, 27 de octubre (ATCC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 26 en esta capital las conversaciones entre la delegacion del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la delegacion militar de alto nivel de la Republica Popular China. 
					　Participaron por la parte coreana el vicemariscal del Ejercito Popular de Corea Ri Yong Ho, vicepresidente de la Comision Militar Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y jefe del Estado Mayor General del EPC, el general de ejercito del EPC Kim Jong Gak, miembro del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la RPDC y primer subjefe de la Direccion Politica General del EPC, el viceministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares Pak Jae Gyong, los generales de ejercito del EPC, Jong Myong Do y Ri Pyong Chol, el coronel general Kim Myong Hwan y otros generales y oficiales del EPC y por la china, el coronel general Guo Boxiong, vicepresidente de la Comision Militar Central de la Republica Popular China, el coronel general Ma Xiaotian, subjefe del Estado Mayor General del Ejercito Popular de Liberacion de China (EPLCh), el coronel general Tong Shiping, subdirector del Departamento Politico General del EPLCh, el coronel general Li Andong, subdirector del Desarrollo de Armamento General del
					
					  EPLCh, el teniente general Zou Yinhe, subdirector del Departamento Logistico General del EPLCh, el teniente general Wang Hongyao, subcomisario politico de la Zona Militar de Shenyang, el teniente general Feng Zhaoju, subcomandante de la Zona Militar de Jinan, el mayor general Cao Yumin, subdirector de la Oficina General de la Comision Militar Central, el mayor general Qian Lihua, director de la Oficina de Asuntos Exteriores del Ministerio de Defensa Nacional, el mayor general Zhou Dao, jefe de Seccion de Publicidad del Departamento Politico General, y otros generales y oficiales, el embajador Liu Hongcai y el agregado militar Sun Yanfeng de la embajada china en Corea.
					
					　En la ocasion ambas partes intercambiaron las opiniones profundas sobre el mayor desarrollo de las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los ejercitos de los dos paises y otros problemas de interes mutuo.
					
					　Las conversaciones transcurrieron en un clima camaraderil y amistoso.

articles.title: Rubricado entre Corea y Siria plan ejecutivo del convenio cultural
articles.content:
Rubricado entre Corea y Siria plan ejecutivo del convenio cultural
Pyongyang, 27 de octubre (ATCC) -- Quedo firmado el dia 27 en esta capital el plan de ejecucion para 2010-2012 del convenio sobre la cooperacion cultural entre los gobiernos de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la Republica Arabe de Siria. 
					　Suscribieron el documento el vicepresidente del Comite Coreano de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero, Jon Yong Jin, y el encargado de negocios a.i. de Siria en Corea, Souheil Haidar.
